narrative_text: I've just been feeling so run down lately, more tired than usual. It's been hard to keep up at work. Also, sometimes my feet feel tingly and numb, especially in the evening. I'm having a hard time remembering to check my sugars because of a stressful new project at work.

Over the past few weeks, I've noticed my vision has been a bit blurry, especially when I'm reading. I also get these terrible headaches in the afternoon. I know I need to be better about taking my medications consistently, but some days I just forget.

I've been trying to get back into jogging, but I keep having to stop because I can't catch my breath. It feels like my chest gets tight and I start wheezing. I've been using my inhaler more often than usual. The weather has been pretty cold and dry lately.

My knees have been killing me, especially when I climb stairs. The pain is worse in the morning when I first wake up. I've been taking ibuprofen but it doesn't seem to help as much as it used to. I'm also feeling more tired than normal despite taking my thyroid medication.

I've been having these episodes where my heart races and I feel like I can't breathe. They happen mostly at night or when I'm in crowded places. The medication helps some, but the attacks have been more frequent lately. Work has been really stressful with upcoming deadlines.

I'm having more trouble breathing, even when I'm just sitting around the house. Walking to the mailbox leaves me winded. I've been coughing more too, especially in the morning. I quit smoking 5 years ago but I'm worried about my lungs getting worse.

I've had three really bad migraines this month, which is more than usual. They start with flashing lights and then the pain is so intense I have to lie down in a dark room. My medication helps but sometimes I have to take it twice. I think stress and lack of sleep might be triggers.

Everything hurts. My muscles ache all over, especially my shoulders and back. I'm exhausted all the time no matter how much I sleep. Some days it's hard to even get out of bed. The weather changes seem to make it worse. I feel like my mood has been really low too.

I've been getting up 3-4 times every night to use the bathroom. It's really affecting my sleep. I'm also really thirsty all the time and my vision has been a little blurry. I've been pretty good about taking my diabetes medication but I haven't been checking my sugar levels regularly.

My periods have been all over the place - sometimes I skip months. I've also gained about 15 pounds in the past few months even though I haven't changed my diet much. I have more facial hair than I used to and it's really bothering me. I'm worried about my fertility.

I've been having really bad heartburn, especially at night. It wakes me up sometimes with this burning sensation in my chest and throat. I take my medication every day but I still get symptoms if I eat certain foods or lie down too soon after eating.

My hands are so stiff in the morning that I can barely hold a cup of coffee. They're also swollen and painful, especially my knuckles. The stiffness lasts for about an hour after I wake up. I'm having trouble doing simple tasks like buttoning my shirt or typing on my computer.

I'm exhausted during the day even though I sleep 8-9 hours at night. My wife says I snore really loudly and sometimes stop breathing. I've fallen asleep at my desk a few times at work. I wake up with headaches almost every morning.

My heart has been racing and fluttering, especially when I'm active. Sometimes it feels like it skips a beat. I get dizzy when this happens and have to sit down. I've been pretty good about taking my blood pressure and heart medications but this still happens.

I've been seeing blood in my stool again and having really bad cramping, especially after I eat. I'm going to the bathroom 6-7 times a day. I've lost about 10 pounds in the last month because I'm afraid to eat. I'm taking my medication as prescribed but it doesn't seem to be working as well.

I have this rash on my face that gets worse when I'm in the sun. My joints are really painful and swollen, especially my hands and knees. I'm more tired than usual and have had low-grade fevers. I'm worried about a lupus flare.

I had what I think was a small seizure last week. I felt this weird sensation and then lost a few minutes of time. My family said I was staring and not responding. I've been taking my medication every day but I've been really stressed and not sleeping well.

The numbness in my legs has been getting worse. I've also been having trouble with my balance and fell twice this month. I'm more fatigued than usual and my vision has been blurry in my right eye. I'm worried this might be a flare-up of my MS.

My ankles and feet have been really swollen, especially by the end of the day. I'm more tired than usual and feel nauseous sometimes. I've been trying to watch my salt intake and take my blood pressure medication regularly. I'm concerned about my kidney function.

My psoriasis has gotten much worse over the past month. The plaques are spreading and really itchy. I've been under a lot of stress at work which I know makes it worse. The medication I'm on doesn't seem to be controlling it as well anymore.

My lower back pain has been unbearable lately. It shoots down my right leg when I stand or walk. I can barely sleep at night because I can't find a comfortable position. The medication helps a little but not enough. Physical therapy hasn't been helping much either.

My hand tremor has gotten noticeably worse. It's affecting my ability to write and eat. I'm also moving more slowly and my balance isn't as good. I feel stiffer in the morning. I'm taking my Parkinson's medication as prescribed but symptoms seem to be progressing.

I've been having more pain crises lately, especially in my chest and back. The pain is severe, like 8 out of 10. I've been really tired and short of breath. I'm worried about having to go to the ER again. I've been taking my hydroxyurea and trying to stay hydrated.

I've been having some stomach cramping and bloating. I'm being really careful with my gluten-free diet but sometimes symptoms still happen. I think I might have accidentally been exposed to gluten at a restaurant last week. I'm also feeling more tired than usual.

I've been having really bad abdominal pain and diarrhea for the past two weeks. I've lost 8 pounds because eating makes the pain worse. I see blood sometimes too. I'm on my biologic medication but this feels like a flare. I'm worried I might need to change medications.

I've been having really extreme mood swings. Some days I feel great and have tons of energy, can't sleep, and my thoughts are racing. Other days I can barely get out of bed and feel hopeless. I'm taking my medications but the ups and downs are getting harder to manage.

I'm here for my regular check-up. Overall I'm feeling pretty good. I take my HIV medication every day and haven't missed any doses. No new symptoms or concerns. Just want to make sure everything is still under control with my labs.

I'm having terrible pelvic pain, especially during my period. The pain is so bad I have to miss work. I also have pain during sex which is affecting my relationship. The medication helps a little but not enough. I'm considering surgical options.

I'm having a lot of trouble urinating. The stream is weak and I feel like I can't empty my bladder completely. I have to get up 3-4 times at night to go. My medication helps but symptoms are still bothering me. I'm concerned this might be getting worse.

I completed my hepatitis C treatment last year and my viral load has been undetectable. I'm here to make sure everything is still good. I feel a lot better than I did before treatment. My energy is back and my appetite is normal. Just want to confirm I'm still cured.

I have this constant burning sensation in my feet. It's worse at night and makes it hard to sleep. My feet also feel numb sometimes. Walking is uncomfortable. The medication I'm taking helps a little bit but the symptoms are still pretty bad.

narrative_title: Increased Swelling and Shortness of Breath
narrative_text: I've been having more trouble breathing, especially when I lie down at night. My ankles are really swollen and I've gained 5 pounds in the past week. I get winded just walking across the room. I'm taking my heart failure medications but symptoms seem to be getting worse.

I've been seeing halos around lights at night. My vision also seems a bit blurry at times. I'm using my eye drops every day as prescribed. I'm worried about my eye pressure going up. My last check was okay but these new symptoms are concerning me.

I'm so exhausted all the time. I can barely make it through the day without needing a nap. I'm taking my iron supplements but I don't think they're helping much. I also get short of breath easily and feel dizzy when I stand up quickly.

My big toe is killing me. It's red, swollen, and extremely painful. This is my third gout attack this year despite taking my medication. I've been trying to avoid trigger foods but it still happens. The pain is so bad I can't even put on a shoe.

I've noticed the lump on my neck seems a bit bigger. It doesn't hurt but I'm worried about it. I also feel like I'm swallowing more frequently. My energy has been okay and I don't have other symptoms, but the nodule is on my mind.

I've been getting chest tightness when I walk uphill or climb stairs. It goes away when I rest. I'm taking all my heart medications as prescribed. I'm worried this might mean my coronary disease is getting worse. I haven't had any chest pain at rest though.

I'm still having hot flashes even though I'm on hormone therapy. They're not as bad as they were but they still wake me up at night. I'm not sleeping well and it's making me irritable during the day. I'm also having some vaginal dryness.

I'm having stomach pain after I eat, especially fatty foods. I also have diarrhea with greasy stools. I'm taking my pancreatic enzymes with every meal but I still have symptoms. I've lost a few pounds because I'm afraid to eat.

I'm here for my regular breast cancer follow-up. I've been taking my tamoxifen every day. No new lumps or concerns with my breasts. I do get hot flashes from the medication but they're manageable. Just want to make sure everything is still clear.

My allergies have been terrible this season. Constant sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes. I'm using my nasal spray but it's not helping as much as usual. The symptoms are affecting my work and sleep. I can't seem to find relief.

I've been having cramping in my lower left abdomen. It comes and goes but is worse after I eat. No fever or bleeding. I've been eating more fiber but the cramping still happens. I'm worried about my diverticulosis acting up.

I have this overwhelming urge to move my legs, especially at night when I'm trying to sleep. It feels like crawling or tingling sensations. I'm taking my medication but symptoms are still bothering me. It's really affecting my sleep quality.

I think I might have another UTI. I'm having burning when I urinate and feel like I need to go all the time. No fever or back pain this time. I've been taking my preventive antibiotic but I still get breakthrough infections. This is really frustrating.

I threw up a small amount of blood yesterday. It was dark red, almost brown. I'm really scared. I've been taking my blood pressure medication for my varices. No abdominal pain but I feel nauseous. I'm worried the varices might be bleeding.

My periods are still irregular and I'm breaking out really badly. I have acne on my face, chest, and back. I'm taking metformin but I don't think it's helping much. I'm also having trouble losing weight no matter what I do.

I get really bad cramping in my calves when I walk more than a block or two. It feels like a charley horse. The pain goes away when I rest but comes back when I start walking again. My feet sometimes feel cold too. I'm worried about circulation.

My vision has gotten worse over the past few months. Things are more blurry and distorted, especially in the center of my vision. I'm taking my eye vitamins every day. I'm having trouble reading and recognizing faces. This is really affecting my quality of life.

I have terrible pain in my heel, especially in the morning when I first step out of bed. It feels like stepping on a nail. The pain improves as the day goes on but never completely goes away. I've tried stretching and ice but nothing seems to help much.

My daughter says I'm more confused lately. I've been forgetting conversations we just had. Sometimes I don't recognize where I am. I get frustrated easily which isn't like me. I'm taking my dementia medications but symptoms seem to be progressing.

I've been sober for 6 months now and I'm proud of that. I'm taking my naltrexone every day and going to meetings. I still get cravings sometimes, especially when I'm stressed. I'm here to check my liver function and make sure everything is improving.
